text: I have something to show you.
It is called cameltoe.
The island of Kauai is the definition fo paradise.

Kauai, Hawaii is the island for any traveller
to likes outdoor activity and seeks adventure.
This is the Hala tree.
It is native to Hawaii.

It's also known as the walking tree because
it has many legs and it is making its way

down toward the water, sun or just to stabilize
itself.

The Polynesians, when they came to Hawaii
one thousand and a half years ago, they used

the leaves of the Hala tree to make sails
for the voyaging canoes.

One of my best days in Kauai was spent on
a day hike with Princeville Ranch Adventures.
It was breathtaking to say the least.
Check out these seeds from the Hala tree.
They are natures paint brushes.
I'm going to try these out.

I have some lilikoi, also known as passionfruit
here.
I'm going to try it.
It smells amazing and tastes sour.
I like it.

Survival 101: If you are ever lost in a forest,
use your hands to cup around your ears, so
you look like an elephant.

Elephant ears allows you to hear sound more
intensely so you can listen to traffic or
other people.
